trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Zionsville
There were no other sightings in Zionsville on or around January 24th 2008
divs: sighting details(note: i am the one who submitted the 8:40 p.m. on march 21, 2005 report titled, "line of bright orange-yellow lights" so i do have some context for this brief report.) at exactly 7:14 p.m. (my car's clock's time), just after i had turned north onto michigan road\u.s. 421 from 146th street (c.r. 300 s), in my peripheral vision above me i saw two bright orange-yellow lights, exactly like the ones i had seen in march 2005, up in the sky, only seemingly higher this time, because they were not quite as big. the two lights were also much closer than when i had seen them in march 2005. i would judge that the lights, when i saw them this time, were over eagletown and, as before, they were moving slowly in a northerly direction. doing my best to watch the road while watching the lights, what i saw, over the span of about 20 seconds, was both lights on, then the right one dimmed over about three seconds and went out, but came back on about three seconds later. then the left one dimmed over about three seconds and went out. about five seconds later, the right one dimmed over about three seconds and then went out. when the left one dimmed and just before it went out, i thought i could vaguely make out a shape that appeared similar to the canopy of a small helicopter, but i couldn't be certain. the sky was crystal clear, though, and i have 20\12.5 vision, and i'm pretty confident i saw some shape in the shadow of the dimming light. hoping to see the lights again - and over a longer period of time - i turned into 156th street, where it is really dark once you get away from michigan road. i stood outside for about 10 minutes (it was about minus 10 with the wind chill), but never saw the lights again, so i went home.
